definitions.definition: To make a soft, shrill noise like a baby bird.
To speak briefly with a quiet voice.
To look, especially through a narrow opening, or while trying not to be seen or noticed.
definitions.example: The man peeped through the small hole.

definitions.definition: To begin to appear; to look forth from concealment; to make the first appearance.
To plunge suddenly into water; to duck; to immerse.
To fall suddenly into water.
To put out; to extinguish.
To strike, beat, or thrash.
To strike or lower in haste; to slacken suddenly
definitions.example: Douse the topsail!

definitions.definition: (professional usage) An auxiliary device with explosive components, used to detonate a munition.
(professional usage) To attach a fuze to.
To touch or cover with the thumb.
definitions.example: to thumb the touch-hole of a cannon

definitions.definition: (with through) To turn the pages of (a book) in order to read it cursorily.
definitions.example: I thumbed through the book and decided not to bother reading it all.

definitions.definition: (travel) To hitchhike
definitions.example: So I started thumbin' back east, toward my hometown.

definitions.definition: To soil or wear with the thumb or the fingers; to soil, or wear out, by frequent handling.
To manipulate (an object) with the thumb; especially, to pull back the hammer or open the cylinder of a revolver.
To fire (a single action revolver) quickly by pulling the hammer while keeping the trigger depressed.
The act by which something is thumbed.
A scholar or researcher in geoscience, an inclusive term for the earth sciences.
Having an atomic valence of 6.
Having a vaccine valence of 6.
To take to pieces; to reverse the process of assembly.
definitions.example: To perform the repair it was necessary to disassemble most of the mechanism.

definitions.definition: To convert machine code to a human-readable, mnemonic form.
A prolonged cry, usually high-pitched, especially as of grief or anguish.
definitions.example: She let out a loud, doleful wail.

definitions.definition: Any similar sound as of lamentation; a howl.
definitions.example: A bird's wail in the night.

definitions.definition: A sound made by emergency vehicle sirens, contrasted with "yelp" which is higher-pitched and faster.
To cry out, as in sorrow or anguish.
To weep, lament persistently or bitterly.
To make a noise like mourning or crying.
definitions.example: The wind wailed and the rain streamed down.

definitions.definition: To lament; to bewail; to grieve over.
definitions.example: to wail one's death

definitions.definition: To perform with great liveliness and force.
To strike the skin in such a way as to produce a wale or welt.
To give a surface a texture of wales or welts.
To choose, select.
To cover with a thin layer of gold; to cover with gold leaf.
To adorn.
To decorate with a golden surface appearance.
To give a bright or pleasing aspect to.
To make appear drunk.
A group or association mainly of tradespeople made up of merchants, craftspeople, or artisans for mutual aid, particularly in the Middle Ages.
A corporation.
A group of diverse species that share common characteristics or habits.
An organized group of players who regularly play together in a multiplayer game.
Any of various edible European bivalve mollusks, of the family Cardiidae, having heart-shaped shells.
The shell of such a mollusk.
(in the plural) One’s innermost feelings (only in the expression “the cockles of one’s heart”).
(directly from French coquille) A wrinkle, pucker
(by extension) A defect in sheepskin; firm dark nodules caused by the bites of keds on live sheep
The mineral black tourmaline or schorl.
The fire chamber of a furnace.
A kiln for drying hops; an oast.
The dome of a heating furnace.
Any of several field weeds, such as the common corncockle (Agrostemma githago) and darnel ryegrass (Lolium temulentum).
A £10 note; a tenner.
To cause to contract into wrinkles or ridges, as some kinds of cloth after a wetting; to pucker.
A faint or veiled and tremulous gleam or shining.
A measure of the irregularities in the loudness of a particular pitch over time.
To shine with a veiled, tremulous, or intermittent light; to gleam faintly.
A thermionic valve containing an anode, a cathode, and a control grid; small changes to the charge on the grid control the flow from cathode to anode, which makes amplification possible.
Debonaire behaviour; graciousness.
Gracious, courteous.
Suave, urbane and sophisticated.
(especially of men) Charming, confident and carefully dressed.
The act of transporting, or the state of being transported; conveyance, often of people, goods etc.
definitions.example: We have to get people out of their cars and encourage them to use alternative forms of transportation.

definitions.definition: Deportation to a penal colony.
definitions.example: Mulligan's sentence was commuted from death to transportation.

definitions.definition: A means of conveyance.
definitions.example: Nice transportation, dude, but your brake lights are busted.

definitions.definition: A ticket or fare.
Pertaining to or resembling a resin.
Any of a class of compounds whose structure or effects on the body resemble retinol (vitamin A).
In an indignant manner
To frighten or cause hesitation; to daunt, put off (usually used in the negative); to disconcert, to perturb.
definitions.example: Jumping out of an airplane does not faze him, yet he is afraid to ride a roller coaster.

definitions.definition: Hesitant, frightened; daunted, disconcerted; perturbed, put off (usually used in the negative).
To impart vigor, strength, or vitality to.
definitions.example: Exercise is invigorating.

definitions.definition: To heighten or intensify.
To give life or energy to.
definitions.example: The cold water invigorated him.

definitions.definition: To make lively.
In a manner inspiring awe.
The degeneration (and death) of neurons
Rustic, pastoral, country-styled.
Relating to the pleasant aspects of rustic country life.
Pertaining to herdsmen or peasants.
A pastoral poem.
A rustic, peasant.
Short-acting barbiturate that is available as both a free acid and a sodium salt.
Discontent; unrest.
Alienation; loss of loyalty.
To seize something and hold it firmly.
To wrestle or tussle.
(with with) To ponder and intensely evaluate a problem.
definitions.example: to grapple with one's conscience

definitions.definition: To fasten, as with a grapple; (by extension) to fix; to join indissolubly.
To climb (whether by means of a grapple and rope, or by hand, etc).
To use a grapple (for example to attempt to find, hook, and raise a net or cable).
To hook and raise with a grapple.
A person who is being mentored
An official person who carries out the capital punishment of a criminal.
Executor.
A hit man, especially being in some organization.
To cause to become an element of something; to insert or fill.
To steep in a liquid, so as to extract the soluble constituents (usually medicinal or herbal).
To inspire; to inspirit or animate; to fill (with).
To instill as a quality.
To undergo infusion.
definitions.example: Let it infuse for five minutes.

definitions.definition: To make an infusion with (an ingredient); to tincture; to saturate.
To pour in, as a liquid; to pour (into or upon); to shed.
A scientific study of form and structure, usually without regard to function. Especially:
The form and structure of something.
A description of the form and structure of something.
A number of sheets of paper put loosely together; especially one of the successive portions of a work printed in numbers.
A memorial of a body; a report of legislative proceedings, etc.
To make final or firm; to finish or complete.
definitions.example: As soon as we get the plane tickets, we'll finalize our reservations with the hotel.

definitions.definition: To prepare (an object) for garbage collection by calling its finalizer.
A player who operates behind the attackers and in front of the defence.
A list of items of special interest.
To delete or forget the address of some entity.
Not bearing an address.
definitions.example: Unaddressed mail cannot be delivered.

definitions.definition: Not discussed or considered.
definitions.example: Have we left any points unaddressed?

definitions.definition: A region, smaller than an ecozone, that contains a distinct biodiversity of flora and fauna.
(digital signal processing) An audio filter that discards higher frequencies while preserving lower ones.
A medical image produced by ultrasound echo
A spectrogram
To perform a sonogram upon.
A place (building, office, shop, or counter) concerned with the business of delivering letters, post or mail and selling stamps, etc.
An organisation that delivers letters.
A party game involving the exchange of kisses.
To unlink; to take or come apart.
definitions.example: radiation decoupled from matter

definitions.definition: The state or condition of being blessed, holy.
To denounce as harmful.
To blame for ills.
Polite behavior.
definitions.example: He was always known for his grace, kindness, and courtesy to people of every rank.

definitions.definition: A polite gesture or remark, especially as opposed to an obligation or standard practice.
definitions.example: I offered them a ride simply as a courtesy.

definitions.definition: Consent or agreement in spite of fact; indulgence.
definitions.example: They call this pond a lake by courtesy only.

definitions.definition: Willingness or generosity in providing something needed.
definitions.example: They received free advertising through the courtesy of the local newspaper.

definitions.definition: A curtsey.
The life interest that the surviving husband has in the real or heritable estate of his wife.
To hoax; to chaff or mock with pretended seriousness of discourse; to make sport of, as by obscure questions.
To peer at; to eye suspiciously or mockingly.
To question closely, to interrogate.
To instruct by means of a quiz.
To play with a quiz.
The act by which somebody is quizzed, or teased; banter, railery.
The asking of questions; interrogation.
To shout extended boos derisively.
definitions.example: When he took the podium, the crowd booed.

definitions.definition: To shout extended boos at, as a form of derision.
definitions.example: The protesters loudly booed the visiting senator.

definitions.definition: A disapproving exclamation by a member of an audience.
The fact or action of becoming or making into a god; deification.
Glorification, exaltation; crediting someone or something with extraordinary power or status.
definitions.example: The turn of the century saw the apotheosis of digital technology.

definitions.definition: A glorified example or ideal; the apex or pinnacle (of a concept or belief).
The best moment or highest point in the development of something, for example of a life or career; the apex, culmination, or climax (of a development).
definitions.example: The apotheosis of her career was her appointment as chairman.

definitions.definition: Release from earthly life, ascension to heaven; death.
The latent entity that mediates between a person's psyche and their thoughts. The id, ego and superego in Freudian Psychology are examples of this.
The study of plant diseases; plant pathology
A complicated situation; an entanglement.
A small, local region having a unique pattern of weather or weather effects that differ from the local climate.
definitions.example: The coastal hills are home to many different microclimates.

definitions.definition: Gruyère cheese
Of, relating to, or between different denominations or churches.
The creation and development of neurons
A company that manufactures integrated circuit chips.
A victory ceremony of less importance than a triumph.
(by extension) A (ceremony for the) recognition of some achievement.
(by extension) Prolonged enthusiastic applause.
To give (someone) an ovation (prolonged enthusiastic applause).
A person who is, or can be, hypnotized.
A soporific substance.
To improve.
To become better; to improve.
To surpass in excellence; to exceed; to excel.
To give advantage to; to support; to advance the interest of.
(with bare infinitive) Should; ought to; need to; must.
definitions.example: The project had better get finished by the current deadline.

definitions.definition: Improvement
A female tiger; a she-tiger.
A magazine targeting an adult male audience and containing nude or semi-nude photographs of women.
definitions.example: When Grandma came to visit, the boy hid the girlies in his dresser so she wouldn't see them.

definitions.definition: A young girl.
definitions.example: Daddy's little girlie

definitions.definition: Lacking liquidity; unable to be converted into cash.
definitions.example: Investment in illiquid assets may prove to be a mistake if the market turns down.

definitions.definition: Of a sheep or goat, to make its characteristic cry; of a human, to mimic this sound.
Of a person, to complain.
definitions.example: The last thing we need is to hear them bleating to us about organizational problems.

definitions.definition: A noise that bleats.
Inane or plaintive chatter.
A tactic or artifice designed to gain the upper hand, especially one involving underhanded dealings or deception.
To bend deeply at the knees while resting on one's feet.
(exercise) To perform one or more callisthenic exercises by moving the body and bending at least one knee.
To occupy or reside in a place without the permission of the owner.
To sit close to the ground; to cower; to stoop, or lie close, to escape observation, as a partridge or rabbit.
To bruise or flatten by a fall; to squash.
A stag that has failed to grow antlers; a cow that has not developed horns.
Especially in hummel corn: grain that lacks awns (beards or bristles), or has had its awns removed (barley, oats, etc.).
